intro: Sacciolepis micrococca, commonly known as the dwarf sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has small, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
